sections.heading: Exemption of Firemen From Carrying Certain Papers.
sections.text:
Notwithstanding any provision of law to the contrary, any fireman while responding to or returning from a fire alarm or while actually engaged in fighting a fire shall be exempt from carrying on his person any certificate, license or any paper or writing required by law to be on his person or presented upon demand of a peace officer.

History:1968, Act 69, Imd. Eff. May 28, 1968
